page.title: 16The Redoubt.
page.content: The {Redoubt Fortress} is one of a line of {coastal defences} built because of the threat of invasion by{ {Napoleon} in the {early nineteenth {century.} It is a large circular fortress surrounded by a moat. In the centre is an open space which is used for { {display} and {concerts} during the summer months. In recent years the fortress has been{ {restored} to its original state. At one time the centre housed a model village. It is possible to walk round the upper part and see some of the { {restored cannons} and their emplacements. Underneath in the old garrison part is a rapidly expanding {museum}showing items from Napoleonic times to the present day. Another part consists of an {Aquarium} and a cafe.
